Class Prime

  • java.lang.Object
    • Prime

  • public class Prime
extends java.lang.Object
    The Prime class represents an application that can be executed to determine the nth prime number (where 2 is the first prime number, 3 is the second, and so forth).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static java.lang.String ANSWER_FORMAT
      The format String, representing how the answer is to be formatted to the user: e.g., "The 5th prime is 11".
      private static java.lang.String ERROR_FORMAT
      The format String, representing an error to be displayed to the user if they input a value less than or equal to zero for n (when asking to see the nth prime).
      private static int FIRST_PRIME
      The first prime number.
      private static java.lang.String POSTFIX_ONE
      The letters to put after the number 1, in "1st".
      private static java.lang.String POSTFIX_OTHER
      The letters to put after any number other than 1, 2, or 3, as in "9th".
      private static java.lang.String POSTFIX_THREE
      The letters to put after the number 3, in "3rd".
      private static java.lang.String POSTFIX_TWO
      The letters to put after the number 2, in "2nd".
      private static java.lang.String QUESTION
      The question to pose to the user, when the user is to input a value n (in order to see the nth prime).

      Constructor and Description
      Prime()

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      Displays a dialog box describing the the nth prime number.
      private static int getPrime(int nth)
      Returns the nth prime number.
      private static boolean isPrime(int num)
      Tests whether the given number is a prime number.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Executes an application which repeatedly asks the user to input n into a dialog box, and replies with another dialog box containing the nth prime number.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Prime

        public Prime()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Executes an application which repeatedly asks the user to input n into a dialog box, and replies with another dialog box containing the nth prime number. The program exits when the user cancels.
        Parameters:
        args - the command-line arguments passed to the JVM, which are ignored by this application.

      • displayPrime

        private static void displayPrime(int nth)
        Displays a dialog box describing the the nth prime number.
        Parameters:
        nth - which prime number to display. Note that this parameter refers to which prime number to display, not the value to display. So, if nth is equal to 4, the 4th prime number (with the value of 7) should be displayed.

      • getPrime

        private static int getPrime(int nth)
        Returns the nth prime number.
        Parameters:
        nth - which prime number should be returned. Note that this parameter refers to which prime number to return, not the value to return. So, if nth is equal to 4, the 4th prime number (with the value of 7) should be returned.
        Returns:
        the nth prime number, where the 1st prime number is Prime.FIRST_PRIME.

      • isPrime

        private static boolean isPrime(int num)
        Tests whether the given number is a prime number. It is assumed that the given parameter is greater than or equal to Prime.FIRST_PRIME.
        Parameters:
        num - the number to test, regarding whether or not it is prime. This value is assumed to be greater than or equal to Prime.FIRST_PRIME.
        Returns:
        true if the given value if prime, or false if the given value is composite (non-prime).
